answers.question: What is the time period to submit an objection for company registration changes?
answers.answer:
- 30 days from the date of publication for objections filed to the General Court regarding partnership company actions (e.g., amendments, dissolution/liquidation).
- 15 days from the date of publication for objections filed with the Companies Department regarding conversion of an individual license to a company (LLC or One-Person Company), typically accompanied by a debt instrument.

answers.question: Where should objections to company registration be submitted?
answers.answer: To the General Court (Court of First Instance).

answers.question: What types of legal entities are mentioned in company registration announcements?
answers.answer:
- One-Person Company (Single Person Company, SPC) — شركة الشخص الواحد (ش.ش.و)
- Limited Liability Company (LLC) — شركة ذات مسؤولية محدودة
- General Partnership Company — شركة تضامنية
- Simple Limited Partnership — شركة توصية بسيطة
- Joint-Stock Company — شركة مساهمة
- Closed Joint-Stock Company — شركة مساهمة مقفلة
- Partnership company (generic category) — شركة أشخاص

answers.question: What happens to joint partner obligations when an objection is filed for company registration?
answers.answer: Filing an objection keeps the joint partners liable to the creditor until a court issues a final ruling on the objection—and this rule applies only to general partnerships and simple limited partnerships.

answers.question: When an individual commercial license is converted into a general partnership, what form must an objection take and what happens if it is not submitted during the announcement period?
answers.answer:
- Form: A written objection accompanied by a debt instrument, filed with the Companies Department.
- Deadline and consequence: It must be submitted within 15 days from the publication date; otherwise, the objection will not be taken into consideration.

answers.question: When a company is being dissolved and liquidated through the Partnerships Department, where must objections be submitted and within what time limit?
answers.answer: Objections must be filed with the General Court (Court of First Instance) within 30 days from the date of publication of the announcement.

answers.question: For Amiri Diwan Practice A/M/804 (announced 11/5/2025), what initial security deposit percentage is required and name two other submission requirements stated?
answers.answer:
- Initial security deposit: 2% of the bid value (via bank guarantee or certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid for the 90-day bid validity).
- Two other submission requirements:
  - Submit the bid in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department, Bayan Palace, Administrative Building, First Floor, Zone 7.
  - Provide a certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage and a valid tax compliance certificate.

answers.question: What is the objection window for changes to a company’s registration?
answers.answer:
- Legal-entity changes or liquidation (handled by the Partnerships Department): 30 days from the date of publication to file an objection with the General Court (Court of First Instance).
- Converting an individual establishment license to a company (handled by the Companies Department): 15 days from the date of publication to submit a written objection to the Companies Department, accompanied by a debt instrument.

answers.question: Where should objections on company registration changes be filed?
answers.answer: To the General Court (Court of First Instance).

answers.question: Which types of legal entities are referenced in the company registration announcements?
answers.answer:
- One-Person Company (Single Person Company/SPC) — شركة الشخص الواحد
- Limited Liability Company (LLC) — شركة ذات مسؤولية محدودة
- General Partnership — شركة تضامنية
- Simple Limited Partnership — شركة توصية بسيطة

answers.question: What is the maximum duration of a commercial lease?
answers.answer:
The provided context does not specify any rules for commercial lease durations. It only covers:
- Company duration: unlimited from registration.
- Fund term: 15 years (renewable).
- Licenses: 3 years (renewable).
- An MoU: 2 years (renewable).

None of these set a maximum duration for commercial leases. If you can specify the jurisdiction or the relevant law/document, I can look up the exact limit.
